Authors:
Margarita Hernandez Restrepo, Rafael F. Castaneda Ruiz,
Josepa Gene, Josep Cano, Josep Guarro
Title: Two new species of Solicorynespora from Spain
Keywords:
Anamorphic fungi, Dothideomycetes, Plant debris,
Taxonomy
Abstract:
Solicorynespora insolita sp. nov. and Solicorynespora
biseptata sp. nov., collected from plant debris in natural areas of
Spain, are described and illustrated. The former species is
characterized by obclavate to fusiform, 4- to 7-septate, dark brown
conidia, with a mucous tunica at the apex; sometimes with an unusual
oblong to bacilliform, hyaline, phialidic conidial synanamorph arising
from the apical cell. Analysis of D1/D2 region rDNA sequences revealed
that this fungus is related to members of the family
Kirschsteiniotheliaceae of the Dothideomycetes. Solicorynespora
biseptata is distinguished by obclavate, 2-septate, brown, but pale
brown at the apex, smooth conidia. This latter fungus did not grow in
culture. A key to species of Solicorynespora is provided.
